title: Shrimp Scampi Linguine
description: A classic Italian-American pasta showcasing tender shrimp sautéed in a bright garlic, lemon and white wine butter sauce tossed with al dente linguine. Fast to prepare, it balances rich butter and olive oil with fresh herbs and a hint of chili for depth.

ingredients.display_name: large shrimp, peeled and deveined (tails on or off)
ingredients.notes: 16-20 count per lb, thawed if frozen
divided (2 tbsp for sauce, 2 tbsp to finish)
can substitute low-sodium chicken or vegetable broth
adjust to taste for mild heat

ingredients.display_name: kosher salt (for pasta water and seasoning)

ingredients.notes: starchy water to adjust sauce consistency

steps.text: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil, add kosher salt, then add linguine and cook until al dente according to package directions. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking and reserve pasta cooking water before draining.
While pasta cooks, pat shrimp dry and season lightly with salt and pepper.

Heat olive oil and half the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering; add shrimp in a single layer and sear until pink and opaque, about 1-2 minutes per side depending on size. Transfer shrimp to a plate and keep warm.
Reduce heat to medium, add minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until fragrant, about 30-45 seconds, taking care not to brown the garlic.
Pour in white wine and scrape up any browned bits from the pan; simmer until wine is reduced by about half, approximately 2-3 minutes.
Stir in remaining butter, lemon juice, lemon zest and red pepper flakes; simmer briefly to meld flavors and emulsify the sauce.
Return shrimp to the skillet along with chopped parsley and a splash of reserved pasta water; toss to warm shrimp through and coat in sauce, about 1-2 minutes.

Add drained linguine to the skillet (or combine in a large bowl), toss thoroughly with the sauce, adding more reserved pasta water as needed to reach a silky consistency. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Plate the linguine and shrimp, finish with grated Parmesan if desired and a final sprinkle of parsley and freshly ground black pepper before serving.
